Class ProductionTabController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.anagalacticruby.ProductionTabController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class ProductionTabController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This is the controller class which houses the methods and fields of the GUI

    This class also houses code regarding the database for this program.

    The main 'structure' of this code can be found in ProductionTabs.fxml

    • Method Detail

      • addProduct

        void addProduct(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method deals with the Add Product button.

        First it will get the information that a user has input in the text fields on the Product Line tab, and insert them into the database of created products. Then, it will print the currently stored products in the database. Afterwards it will update the table and ObservableList that are meant to store the information a user input. Afterwards it will clear all the text fields, and disable the button itself. This is to prevent massive spams to the database, as well as allow the user to process what has been completed.(This method also removes the sample values of the table the first time this method is run)

        Parameters:
        event - An event listener that in this case, is listening for the user to click on the button

      • addProgress

        void addProgress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        This method adds progress to the bar to show to the user how much progress on adding a new product they have made.

        The user can only add a product if all text fields and the type are filled.

        Parameters:
        event - This event handler checks for when keys are typed in the text fields

      • changeTheme

        void changeTheme(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method allows you to change the themes of the program. c:
        Parameters:
        event - this event cares about the checkboxes on the Settings tab.

      • checkProgress

        void checkProgress(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method adds progress to the bar to show to the user how much progress on adding a new product they have made.

        The user can only add a product if all text fields and the type are filled. The way this method differs from the previous is that it is checking the choice box.

        Parameters:
        event - This event handler checks when the user clicks on the product type choice box

      • generateDetails

        void generateDetails(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This event generates the employee details for an employee.
        Parameters:
        event - Takes in the password and full name input by the employee in their respective fields.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        This method sets up the program's environment the moment the program starts running.

        This method will be run every time the program is run, and does the following calls and setup. Most of this method's functionality lies in what items need to be prepared before the user gets to them or so that elements are properly displaying the right details.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - location
        resources - resources

      • recordProduction

        void recordProduction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method is tied to the Record Product button.

        It allow users to select a product that has been created in the Product Line tab, and the amount of this product to record. After the amount and product to record production of have been selected, this method will insert the production record of these products in the Production Log tab's text area.

        Parameters:
        event - When an action occurs to this button, perform the following code.
